metadata.title: CVE-2014-3563 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Salt (aka SaltStack) before2014.1.10 allow local users to have an unspecified impact via vectorsrelated to temporary file creation in (1) seed.py, (2) salt-ssh, or (3)salt-cloud.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3563` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-common - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
salt-master - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
salt-minion - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
salt-ssh - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
salt-syndic - 0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: salt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.17.5+ds-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
